subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Thursday, April 26, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Note: CNN's Political Ticker will provide
constant real-time updates, campaign spin and reaction, and
expert analysis beginning at 7 p.m. ET.

Today
on the Ticker

Senate sends Iraq spending bill
to White House for threatened veto

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
The Senate on Thursday approved a $124 billion war spending
bill that calls for U.S. combat troops to leave Iraq in 2008,
sending the measure to the White House for a threatened veto by
President Bush.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/senate-sends-iraq-spending-bill-to_26.html

***

Rice says she'll respond to subpoena with letter

OSLO, Norway (AP) -- Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice
said Thursday she has already answered the questions she has
been subpoenaed to answer before a U.S. congressional committee
and suggested she is not inclined to comply with the order.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/rice-says-shell-respond-to-subpoena.html

***

Jim Gilmore throws his hat in the ring

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Virginia Gov. Jim Gilmore
launched his long-shot presidential bid in a webcast from Iowa
Thursday, criticizing the leading candidates for not being
conservative enough.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/jim-gilmore-throws-his-hat-in-ring.html

***


McCain criticized for joking about explosive devices
in Iraq

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Republican presidential
contender John McCain dismissed a demand by a prominent House
Democrat that he apologize to U.S. troops in Iraq for making a
joke about an explosive device, saying critics should "lighten
up."

Full story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-criticized-for-joking-about.html

***

Gore, Bloomberg wink at 2008 rumors

NEW YORK (AP)
-- Al Gore continues to talk about global warming, and
presidential politics.

Gore and New York Mayor Michael
Bloomberg helped kick off the Tribeca Film Festival, which
features several environmentally-themed films this year.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/gore-bloomberg-wink-at-2008-rumors.html

***

McCain: Gonzales should depart 'out of loyalty' to Bush

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Republican presidential candidate
Sen. John McCain said Wednesday that he is "disappointed" in
the performance of embattled Attorney General Alberto Gonzales,
and he believes it would be in President Bush's best interests
for Gonzales to step aside.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-gonzales-should-depart-out-of.html
